steps.modified_description: transfer-transfer water to a kettle, but splash some water outside

steps.description: Boil-Boil the water. (While the water is boiling, assemble the filter cone)
steps.modified_description: Boil-Don't boil the water. (assemble the filter cone)

steps.description: Place-Place the dripper on top of a coffee mug
Prepare-Prepare the filter insert by folding the paper filter in half to create a semi-circle, and in half again to create a quarter-circle
spread-spread open filter in dripper to create a cone

check-Once the water has boiled, check the temperature of the water. (The water should be between 195-205 degrees Fahrenheit or between 91-96 degrees Celsius. If the water is too hot, let it cool briefly.)
steps.modified_description: check-Once the water has boiled, check the temperature of the water. But the water temperature is wrong

steps.description: Transfer-Transfer the grounds to the filter cone
Pour-Pour a small amount of water into the filter to wet the grounds
Wait-Wait about 30 seconds for the coffee to bloom. (You will see small bubbles or foam on the coffee grounds during this step.)
steps.modified_description: Wait-Wait about 15 seconds for the coffee to bloom. (You will see small bubbles or foam on the coffee grounds during this step.)

steps.description: pour-Slowly pour the rest of the water over the grounds in a circular motion. Do not overfill beyond the top of the paper filter
steps.modified_description: pour-Slowly pour the rest of the water over the grounds in a circular motion. But overfill beyond the top of the paper filter

errors.description: overfill beyond the top of the paper filter

steps.description: drain-Let the coffee drain completely into the mug before removing the dripper
steps.modified_description: drain-Let the coffee drain into the mug, and remove the dripper in advance

steps.description: Discard-Discard the paper filter and coffee grounds

errors.description: Place-Place the paper filter in the dripper
Grind-Grind the coffee beans until the coffee grounds are the consistency of coarse sand, about 20 seconds
